Name: Checkbox
Description: A control that allows the user to toggle between checked and not checked.

SubComponents.Name: Root
SubComponents.Description: Contains all the parts of a checkbox. An input will also render when used within a form to ensure events propagate correctly.

Props.Name: asChild
Props.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

Props.Name: defaultChecked
Props.Description: The checked state of the checkbox when it is initially rendered. Use when you do not need to control its checked state.

Props.Name: checked
Props.Description: The controlled checked state of the checkbox. Must be used in conjunction with onCheckedChange.

Props.Name: onCheckedChange
Props.Description: Event handler called when the checked state of the checkbox changes.

Props.Name: disabled
Props.Description: Event handler called when the checked state of the checkbox changes.

Props.Name: required
Props.Description: When true, indicates that the user must check the checkbox before the owning form can be submitted.

Props.Name: name
Props.Description: The name of the checkbox. Submitted with its owning form as part of a name/value pair.

Props.Name: value
Props.Description: The value given as data when submitted with a name.

SubComponents.Name: Indicator
SubComponents.Description: Renders when the checkbox is in a checked or indeterminate state. You can style this element directly, or you can use it as a wrapper to put an icon into, or both.

Props.Name: asChild
Props.Description: Change the default rendered element for the one passed as a child, merging their props and behavior.  Read our Composition guide for more details.

Props.Name: forceMount
Props.Description: Used to force mounting when more control is needed. Useful when controlling animation with React animation libraries.
